Really nice guy, clearly cares a lot about his students.



As a 300 lvl phil course, it is expected to be discussion based. found he allowed for certain students to monopolize classroom conversation and it quickly became a hostile environment for anyone wanting to contribute. otherwise was a fair marker.

Sam has taught me many times and overall he's great. Exams are really tough...if you don't study HARD, you won't do well. On the bright-side, he's more lenient than most when marking papers and gives lots of good feedback. He loves talking to students about subject matter so go see him in office hours! Super passionate about what he does.

Jenn always shows her care to the students. She is willing to answer your question outside the classroom. Her feedback is a good guidance to get a good grade. Jenn is also an easy grader, just try your best to complete the assignments and papers and you will be good!

History of ethics is interesting when taught clearly, organized and straight forward. Jennifer was pretty disorganized and unprepared in this class and presented some of the material very intuitively and speculatively. Her feedback was not helpful, reflecting her teaching method, namely confusing and obscure. Marking was not great either.

Nic provides an incredible model for all profs to consider when it comes to teaching online. His lectures were concise, the assignments were engaging and his book was incredible. While this class was somewhat easy, I truly believe most of that comes down to how he is able to motivate and interest you in the subject matter. An incredible author/prof

I'm a phil major who has taken over 15 phil courses at SFU and I have never been so disappointed with a class before. It's not a writing course but we wrote five 1000 word papers and homework assignments each week that r at least another 700 words each. I never learned anything from attending lectures. Overall just bad. Too much work, no learning.

I did pretty badly in this class, but Tiffany's a great prof. He renewed my interest in Philosophy. Actually interesting lectures. Hard marker on essays though and didn't write many helpful comments. I'd definitely take another class with him!
